title: X Factor Celebrity: Who’s in the lineup for tonight?
text:
Nicole Scherzinger, who auditioned on US show Popstars at the start of her career, is a judge on X Factor Celebrity (Picture: Rex)

Simon Cowell has admitted that X Factor Celebrity is a gamble that could end in his own humiliation or a Kylie Minogue-style success story for successful members of the lineup.

The creator of the reality behemoth has enlisted a somewhat unlikely list of names to take part in the latest version of his show, ranging from newsreaders and rugby players to actors and social media influencers.

Dermot O’Leary will front each episode, with familiar faces Louis Walsh and Nicole Scherzinger among the judges.

‘My credibility is at stake,’ admitted Cowell. ‘If it doesn’t work, I look like a total idiot. No pressure.’

Cowell named Kylie, who went to hit number one in the UK with her latest retrospective this year after turning to singing in the late 1980s, as an example of how the celebrities could switch disciplines because of the show.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Sometimes people do need these shows to give themselves that head start,’ he said, adding: ‘There have been 15 years of X Factor and it’s been great.

‘We’ve had amazing people over the years. It’s time for something different.’

Who are the contestants on X Factor Celebrity?

The show is split into three categories – Overs (contestants over the age of 28), Unders (those who are under that age) and Groups.

In the first episode of the show, broadcast last week, fans watched veteran newsreader Martin Bashir, who is best known for quizzing the likes of Michael Jackson, singing jazz great Nat King Cole’s L.O.V.E in front of the judges.

Cowell, Walsh and Scherzinger sang along, smiled and clapped as the 56-year-old news anchor broke into song.

Bashir is part of the Overs category alongside Emmy Award winner Ricki Lake, who became the youngest talk show host in the US.

The Chase gatekeeper Jenny Ryan also received praise from Scherzinger for her performance in week one.

Lake seemed to have taken heed of Cowell’s call to arms in episode one, saying: ‘I’m hoping to become a singer. I’m all about reinvention – I’m all about trying new things and improving myself in different ways.

‘I really want to surprise people so I’m working hard and practising a lot.’

Who is on the X Factor Celebrity tonight?

Megan McKenna – no stranger to reality TV after making her name on The Only Way Is Essex – is one of the wannabe singers taking part.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Another soap star, Jonny Labey, who is the youngest solo contestant, will be appearing along with Olivia Olson, who sang in rom-com classic Love Actually, and Coronation Street’s Victoria Ekanoye.

TOWIE’s Megan McKenna will be going for a song in the show (Picture: Rex)

V5 – a quintet of social media influencers – will compete, as well as Coronation Street’s Victoria Ekanoye.

The X Factor: Celebrity is on ITV tonight at 8.35pm.

MORE: Olivia Olson is breaking free from the shackles of Love Actually on X Factor Celebrity: ‘I refuse to sing Mariah Carey’
description: From Megan McKenna to Olivia Olson, here's who's appearing on X Factor: Celebrity tonight.
